content: 61 cm © 2020 ruth brasch page 2 of 2 pattern chain 9 photo 1 join the chain in a circle with a slip_stitch photo 2 chain 2 does not count as a stitch double_crochet 9 into the chain circle photo 3 turn begin working in tunisian crochet terminology photo 4 shows the first and last stitches to work into on row 2 row 2 tss 8 photo 5 etss photo 10 retp complete in photo 6 photo 6 shows the first and last stitches to work into on row 3 row 3 yo tss2tog x4 photo 7 etss retp photo 8 shows a completed repeat of row 3 with arrows pointing to two of the closed yos in each tss2tog from this point on the second tss will be a yo from the previous row sometimes they hide- make sure you pick them up row 4 tss yo tss2tog x3 tss etss photo 9 retp continue to work alternating row 3-4 until your work measures approximately 4 10 cm shorter than the intended wearer s head circumference not including the buttonhole loop work row 2 once more next row slip_stitch in each vertical bar across photo 11 turn photo 12 last row chain 2 does not count as a stitch double_crochet decrease double_crochet until 3 sts before end of row decrease double_crochet photo 13 shows a decrease half completed cut yarn weave in all ends and attach button to the end of the headband that does not have the loop enjoy terms of use this pattern is for your own use finished projects may be sold as long as they are your own handmade work this pattern may not be mass manufactured all written instructions and photos are copyright 2020 ruth brasch and ruth brasch design you may not reproduce them in anyway including screenshots copying and pasting reposting to your own blog etc i d love to see your headband please tag @ruthbrasch or #ruthbraschdesign on social media when you share it © 2020 ruth brasch
